intro: Exorhopala ruficeps, commonly known as the red-headed grasshopper, is a species of short-horned grasshopper native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acrididae and is characterized by its distinctive reddish head and thorax. The plant it inhabits typically includes grasslands and open areas with abundant vegetation. Its life cycle involves laying eggs in the soil, which hatch into nymphs that undergo several molts before reaching adulthood. The botanical significance of this species lies in its role as an indicator of habitat health and its contribution to the ecological balance of its environment.
